text.36_Daf, 38_Line: “…the word of the Lord, whose fire is in Zion and whose stove is in Jerusalem.” (Isaiah 31:9)
text.36_Daf, 37_Line: In Jerusalem, as it is written
text.36_Daf, 34_Line: “They, and all they possessed, descended alive into the grave…” (Bamidbar 16:33)
text.36_Daf, 32_Line: there are three entrances to gehinnom. One in the wilderness, one in the sea and one in Jerusalem.
text.36_Daf, 33_Line: In the wilderness, as it is written
text.36_Daf, 36_Line: “…from the belly of the grave I cried out, You heard my voice.” (Yonah 2:3)
text.36_Daf, 40_Line: ‘whose fire is in Zion’ refers to gehinnom, ‘whose stove is in Jerusalem’ refers to the entrance to gehinnom.
text.36_Daf, 35_Line: In the sea, as it is written
text.36_Daf, 39_Line: It was taught in the school of R’ Yishmael:
